explanation: No additional symbols are required. The MISRA rule concerns the well-formedness of for statements in the target function (including effects of functions called from inside such for bodies). OS_TaskExit contains no for statement at all — all calls (OS_TaskGetId_Impl, OS_ObjectIdGetById, OS_TaskDetach_Impl, OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete, OS_TaskExit_Impl) occur outside any for loop — so there is nothing to check against that MISRA rule inside this function. Therefore no callee/source symbols are needed to determine compliance for OS_TaskExit itself.
